column1: The '''Far Downs''' were the downlands that marked the former western borders of [[the Shire]], forty leagues (120 miles) west from the [[Brandywine Bridge]].<ref>{{FR
column2: Hobbits}}</ref> Of their geography almost nothing is known, except that the town of [[Greenholm]] seems to have been built among the Downs.
Elessar]] extended the Shire's borders westward to the [[Tower Hills]] in {{SR
column3: 1452}}, with the [[Westmarch]] laying in-between. [[Fastred of Greenholm]] became the first [[Warden of Westmarch]].<ref>{{App

column1: In [[Ballantine Books]]' paperback edition of ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]'' there was a misprint in the [[The Lord of the Rings Prologue
column2: Prologue]] that incorrectly named the Far Downs as the "Fox Downs".<ref>{{FR
